## AbstractConnector class

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare abstract class AbstractConnector implements Connector 
```
<b>Implements:</b> Connector

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [\_addSegment(clazz, params)](./core.abstractconnector._addsegment) |  |  |
|  [\_clearSegments()](./core.abstractconnector._clearsegments) |  |  |
|  [\_compute(geometry, params)](./core.abstractconnector._compute) |  |  |
|  [\_findSegmentForLocation(location, absolute)](./core.abstractconnector._findsegmentforlocation) |  | returns \[segment, proportion of travel in segment, segment index\] for the segment that contains the point which is 'location' distance along the entire path, where 'location' is a decimal between 0 and 1 inclusive. in this connector type, paths are made up of a list of segments, each of which contributes some fraction to the total length. From 1.3.10 this also supports the 'absolute' property, which lets us specify a location as the absolute distance in pixels, rather than a proportion of the total path. |
|  [\_updateSegmentProportions()](./core.abstractconnector._updatesegmentproportions) |  |  |
|  [boundingBoxIntersection(box)](./core.abstractconnector.boundingboxintersection) |  |  |
|  [boxIntersection(x, y, w, h)](./core.abstractconnector.boxintersection) |  |  |
|  [compute(params)](./core.abstractconnector.compute) |  |  |
|  [exportGeometry()](./core.abstractconnector.exportgeometry) |  | Subclasses can override this. By default we just pass back the geometry we are using internally. |
|  [findSegmentForPoint(x, y)](./core.abstractconnector.findsegmentforpoint) |  | Function: findSegmentForPoint Returns the segment that is closest to the given \[x,y\], null if nothing found. This function returns a JS object with:<!-- -->d - distance from segment l - proportional location in segment x - x point on the segment y - y point on the segment s - the segment itself. |
|  [getDefaultStubs()](./core.abstractconnector.getdefaultstubs) |  |  |
